topic.title: Using the web console
topic.shortdesc: The Couchbase Web Console is the main tool for managing the Couchbase environment.

body.p: The web console provides the following tabs:

dlentry.dd: A quick guide to the status of your Couchbase cluster.
Shows active nodes, node configuration, node activity and performance, and cluster statistics. Provides node failover and node removal.
Creates data buckets, edits bucket settings, and views bucket statistics.
Creates and manages view functions for indexing and querying data including managing documents.
Shows existing indexes listed per Bucket, Node, or Index name.
Provides configuration and information for the cluster, updates notifications, auto failover, alerts, auto compaction, sample buckets and account management.
